title: ELEMENT_TYPES view | Snowflake Documentation
paragraphs:
This Information Schema view displays a row for each structured ARRAY type in an
object (a column in a table) in the specified (or current) database.
Each row describes the type of the element in the structured ARRAY.
Database that contains the object that uses this ARRAY type.
Schema that contains the object that uses this ARRAY type.
Name of the object that uses this ARRAY type (e.g. name of a table).
Type of the object that uses this ARRAY type:
Type identifier. Use this to join on:
The DTD_IDENTIFIER column in the COLUMNS view.
The DTD_IDENTIFIER column in this view (for nested types).
The DTD_IDENTIFIER column in the FIELDS view (for nested types).
Maximum length in characters of string elements.
Maximum length in bytes of string elements.
Radix of precision of numeric elements.
The collation specification for this element
Maximum cardinality. Currently, this is always set to NULL.
Nested type identifier. Use this to join on:
The COLLECTION_TYPE_IDENTIFIER column in this view.
The ROW_IDENTIFIER column in the FIELDS view (for nested types).
The view only displays objects for which the current role for the session has been granted access privileges.

The view does not honor the MANAGE GRANTS privilege and consequently may show less information compared to the
SHOW COLUMNS command when both are executed by a user who holds the MANAGE GRANTS privilege.
